newsitem.title: USA: Mexico's PEMEX cuts June crude prices to the U.S.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's PEMEX cuts June crude prices to the U.S.

text.p: Mexico cut most June crude price differentials to the United States and Asia on Friday, according to trade sources who had seen the latest price telex from state oil monopoly Petroleos Mexicanos (Pemex).
Pemex dropped its price for light Isthmus crude 15 cents per barrel to the U.S., Maya heavy crude 15 cents and Olmeca by 10 cents.
The reduced differentials put Isthmus to the U.S. at the Pemex formula, which includes crudes and products, minus $1.85.
Maya to the U.S. is now minus $2.40 and Olmeca at formula minus 45 cents.
To Asia, Pemex cut Isthmus prices by 10 cents and Maya heavy was left unchanged. Isthmus is now at a 40 cents premium to Oman/Dubai, and Maya at the benchmark minus $3.30.
As reported earlier, prices to Europe were left unchanged.
